name: Residence Inn by Marriott Toronto Downtown / Entertainment District

reviews.text: This is a fairly new hotel when we stayed there. There were a couple of construction quirks still going on at the time. They were still working on the sidewalk in front of the door and the whirlpool was very cold.
reviews.title: Wonderful place to stay.

likes.liked: — The evening snacks and breakfast. The room.
likes.disliked: — Crowded breakfast, to small an area for that many guests.

reviews.title: Amazing city centre hotel!!!!
reviews.text: The room was great. Location was great, especially if you were going to a ballgame. Staff tried to be helpful but some of them were new to the area also.
Loved the evening snack. One night it was so good we made it a meal.
reviews.title: Exceptional!!!

reviews.text: The only problem was breakfast was crowded, there wasn't enough seating and the staff was having trouble keeping up with plates and silverware. The food was great, it was the best oatmeal I 've ever had and that is saying something.
reviews.title: Great location & FANTASTIC continental breakfast

reviews.text: Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Loved it......

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the room and the many amenities in the room.
likes.disliked: — The valet parking fee of $30 per night

reviews.text: Beautiful new rooms with all the amentiies. Very clean and spacious. Generous buffet complimentry breakfast included with stay. The only thing was, is that there were no vending machines, no where to get food late at night except for the market across the street, which was also closed. Othere than that, absolutely no complaints.
reviews.title: Great new hotel

reviews.text: What a great hotel! It is located within walking distance of various arenas, restaurants and bars and very walkable to the trolley or subway (is about 10 minutes). There is a parking garage on the alley behind the hotel, where we parked for a much better rate than valet, if you leave the lobby and walk to the right of the hotel, it is in the alley to your immediate right. The check-in staff was quick and professional and assigned us a room just as we requested.
reviews.title: Good stuff!

likes.liked: — Close to transit, beautiful and comfortable rooms, great free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Parking fee (use garage in alley instead), no free internet, need better items in snack shop

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Our room was incredibly nice, just as everyone had stated in their reviews. As you walk in there is a full kitchen with all the amenities including a toaster, glass top oven range, fridge, microwave, dishes, paper towels, dish soap, everything you would need to cook a meal. There was a nice desk with chair (no free high speed, which was incredibly disappointing, as I thought all Residence Inn's had free high speed). There was also a fold out sofa, another chair and some tables (including a kitchen style table), so there was plenty of room to spread out.

The studio suite had a nice large king sized bed that was high off the ground. Only peeve is that it was literally a foot from the windows. Noise wasn't terrible from the outside (since we were so high up), however we did get woken up a few times throughout the night with sirens and things. We didn't hear much of any inside noise, except for a few people in the hallway, so the construction must be good. There was a nice mix of feather/poly pillows on the comfortable bed and the linens were clean. There is a fantastic LG TV that had a ton of international channels with CC, it was in analog mode, but still looked quite nice. There is a large closet with ample hangers and nice new iron with ironing board. Ample drawers for your things. The bathroom was a good size and including a vanity outside the toilet/shower area. Nice soft towels. Was clean and had good water pressure.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

likes.liked: — The suite style which was great
likes.disliked: — The view was not brilliant but we were not in it for the view

reviews.text: The free breakfast was wonderful, eggs, sausage, waffle maker, yogurt with toppings, oatmeal, toast, Danish, juices, coffee, etc. The wait was crazy the first morning and there was a line, I just wanted to take something to the room, and didn't want to wait. The next morning, luckily, no line. They provided a tray so I could carry my goodies to the room, was excellent.
reviews.title: A wonderful gem in Entertainment District

likes.liked: — Spacious, free hot breakfast, close to the action

reviews.text: We booked a one-bedroom suite at this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and were pleased to find it was all true!
reviews.title: Quiet, quiet, quiet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were incredibly friendly; whenever we stepped into the elevator, if any staff member was there also they would smile and say Welcome, and ask how our stay was so far.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — That the block around the hotel was almost deserted

reviews.text: The cleaning staff were utterly outstanding. I wanted to pack them into my suitcase and bring them all home with me. Kind, efficient, excellent!
reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel in Toronto

likes.liked: — The Staff is truly interested in pleasing the guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was perfect in every way, including the view, and I was truly surprised as to how quiet it was! We're fairly certain the floor was concrete under the wood subfloor, which made for a very quiet stay. We barely heard a peep from anyone else.
reviews.title: Excellent rooms; perfect for families with children

reviews.text: The decor of the rooms was fresh and nice, and the kitchen was clean and well-equipped. The bathroom was a tad small but it certainly fit one person at a time.
reviews.title: Good value but staff service quality is uneven

likes.liked: — Large clean rooms, great housekeeping staff
likes.disliked: — Junior untrained employees on the front desk, often ignorant of hotel basics

reviews.title: The three "C"s comfortable, clean, convenient
reviews.text: We spent one night at the Residence Inn and were thrilled with our experience. The rooms were the cleanest I've ever seen and the staff went above and beyond to ensure that our needs were met. Great room, great staff, great hotel!!!
Recently stayed twice at the Residence Inn in Downtown Toronto at the beginning and end of a 3 week tour of Eastern Canada and New England.
reviews.title: Deservedly Ranked #1 in Toronto!

likes.liked: — brand new rooms,very modern,location in downtown toronto
likes.disliked: — breakfast room fills up fast on weekday mornings

reviews.text: The hotel is new or at least newly refurbished and anyone who spends time in hotels knows how rare this is!
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: We were 2 adults + 1 child and we stayed in a studio suite which proved to be very spacious,great kitchen with coffee machine,dishwasher,micro,full size fridge etc.
reviews.title: The best hotel I've stayed at in Toronto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had a large screen LG Plasma TV and the bed was a huge Kingsize !
reviews.title: Lived up to reputation :-)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown for 3 days. The staff was superb as was the room. The complimentary breakfast included a big selection of hot items and pastries. Two downsides to this hotel is that 1) this is a hotel frequented by families and 2) the elevators are extremely slow. One had to eat early in order to avoid the breakfast room becoming crowded with loud and extremely energetic kids. We checked in to the hotel around 11 am and the kids breakfast scene was in full swing. The amount of people plus the two already slow elevators made it take a long time to get to and from your room. Notwithstanding this, the location of the hotel + the cost make it a great value.
reviews.title: Good value hotel; close to sites

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite up on arrival instead of the studio we had booked. We also had a weekend package price so this was truely a great value for the price to stay here.
reviews.title: Good value and large rooms.

likes.liked: — The location close to sights like CN tower.
likes.disliked: — The restaurant where breakfast was served a bit noisy.

reviews.text: A hot breakfast is included it was standard hotel breakfast nothing more or less. The room had a bedroom, a lounge, bathroom and a kitchen.
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was large and spatious. Nice colours and design.
reviews.title: Great location ,great hotel

likes.liked: — the value of the big room
likes.disliked: — VERY THIN WALLS you hear everything like bar hpong home comers at all hours

reviews.text: As the hotel is still rather new everything also still looks very clean.
reviews.title: August 13 2008

likes.liked: — A relaxed feel about the place
likes.disliked: — The poor connection for the internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here mid January 08 for two nights. I'm partial to Marriott hotels to begin with but this new hotel was excellent. The location is wonderful. We had a rental vehicle which we never used once to get around the city. You are only several blocks from Chinatown, the CN tower, and all the sporting stadium/arenas. The hotel staff was the friendliest I have ever seen at a Marriott and were very helpful in providing information on good restaurants, good bars, and directions.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, great location, wonderful new hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is wonderful as I stated because it is new. THe fitness area is sufficient for a quick workout, don't expect a real gym. The indoor pool was suprisingly large and the hot tub wasn't as warm as I would have liked but that's just a personal issue.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.disliked: — valet parking is $30 however it's as much anywhere downtown Toronot

reviews.text: The room was large and the bed was great. For anyone that has stayed at a Residence Inn, it is a typical Residence Inn. The evening snacks and cocktail reception were excellent. For someone who wants to have a small meal, it would be sufficient for your dinner. One night we had Indian food which was great and the other night was "Sports" night so it was just hot dogs but good enough. The breakfasts were also supprisingly decent for a free buffet.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.text: Overall for the location and hotel ammenities, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is not a luxury hotel but it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great business destination property

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Residence Inn for business purposes but would return for pleasure anytime. This is a top notch hotel with the friendliest staff I've ever encountered. This is a new hotel with beautifull decor. The free hot breakfast was more than adequate. For the location and good value, this hotel beats any of the others in this area of Toronto...and over the years we have tried them all. This will be our first choice from now on.
reviews.title: Excellent new hotel

reviews.text: This is a terrific hotel. We relied on Trip Advisor and booked a number of rooms for 2 nights in September 2007. Hotel staff is excellent. Attentive and willing to assist with any questions or issues that arise. Hazel was a gem. Hotel is new and clean. Rooms - especially 2 bedroom suites, are large and very comfortable. The suites are a deal as the beds are big enough for 2 to sleep comfortably and the pull out sofa can accomodate 2 people. The kitchens allow you ample room and kitchenware to cook - micro, dishes, big fridge, coffee pot etc. Perfect set up if you don't want to eat all your meals out. 2 large bathrooms in the 2 bedroom suites with ample towels and bath products. TVs are flat screen and good. Hot breakfast is nice. Evening happy hour has some good snacks and if the Tin Whistle Brewery is hosting FREE BEER!!! 2-3 blocks from Rogers Centre, CN Tower and walking distance to good restaurants and entertainment. If traveling with kids this is a good choice because of the spacious suites, kitchens and breakfast. The regular studios were also very nice and good size. Upon our return to Toronto this will be our first choice of hotels!!!
reviews.title: thumbs up!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read the reviews of this hotel before booking. Most of the positives are true to form, and the pictures accurately show the nice decor of the hotel and room. A few tips for future guests:
reviews.title: A great hotel, expensive parking...

likes.liked: — Excellent modern decor and kitchen conveniences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) There is not much of a loading/unloading area for guests. There is one lane available on a small one lane street (Wellington). We were nervous about leaving the car there for an extended period, but it seems you can leave it there as long as you need to unload and take the things up to your room. I didn't see anyone monitoring the cars parked there.
reviews.title: Good, but needs some help

likes.disliked: — Location--after being in Toronto for a couple of days, we realized we would rather be in another part of town, even though we were there for the theatre and symphony

reviews.text: 2) The valet service is $30 a day and way too much money for us! We read on this site of an underground garage behind the hotel, about a 30 second walk. It is in the alley right behind the hotel. Note that the hotel seemed ambiguous about helping us find alternative parking (understandably). We went to the attendant and he told us it would be $40 for our three day/two night weekend stay. I thought that was high (after seeing a surface lot for less $$) and was inclined to check elsewhere. When we indicated we might find something cheaper, he lowered the rate to $30. I guess you can barter! Also note the hours on the structure; I believe there is no attendant between 3 am and 7 am. He gave us the code to open the gate if we needed to move our car outside of those times.
reviews.title: horrible service

reviews.text: 3) On a personal note, there is a great restaurant on King Street (north side), a few blocks east of the hotel and east of the theaters. Keep your eyes open for it, as you enter a few steps below street level. It is called Big Daddy's and specializes in creole/cajun type food. Great ambiance and service. We went there twice, one to eat and once for drinks. Weekdays before 6 is happy hour w/ a great selection of low priced appetizers/small plates, and "buck and shuck" oysters. They are great!
reviews.title: Victim of its own sucess ?

reviews.text: My husband and I just got back from a one night stay at the Residence Inn for the second time in the last couple of months. We went with another couple and we booked the 2 bedroom suite. It was extremely large which gave us all privacy. The staff are incredible!!! As this is a new hotel, the rooms are spotless and very chic. The valet parking is a little expensive, but as the location of the hotel is perfect, you will not have to drive anywhere once you arrive (especially if you are going to the theatre). The best part about the hotel is the "homey" feel. It is so comfortable you will not want to leave. We will definately continue to stay at this hotel everytime we visit Toronto!
reviews.title: Second Time Around

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in Sept 2007. It was wonderful! This hotel is brand new and just opened in July 2007. I'm very particular about cleanliness, musty smell in room so trust me when I say I highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 king suites on the 11th and 17th floor and they look exactly as the picture posted on the hotel website. We paid $199/per night and
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel within walking distance of everything

likes.liked: — spacious and well presented accomodation, great hotel all round
likes.disliked: — there was nothing to dislike about this hotel

reviews.text: booked through the hotel website because that was the best rate available compared to other websites.
reviews.title: Great location, Nice fitout, Good food

likes.disliked: — Air conditioning was a little noisy

reviews.text: The room was huge, the king size bed was very comfortable, there's a dining table for 2, a couch in the sitting area, LCD television, microwave, full fridge, dishwasher, sink, utensils and china. The room
reviews.title: Memorable stay

likes.liked: — Size of room, free Internet, pristine conditon

reviews.text: Found this hotel on tripadvisor. It lived up to our expectations; it was clean, the staff was nice, and the price fair. Very recommendable.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Residence Inn from 6-10 June 2008 for 4 nights.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a city break

reviews.text: We had a 2 bed suite on the 14th floor which had everything you need even had large dishwasher and a huge fridge/freezer which came in handy for ice cream as there was an heatwave on whilst we were there. Could not fault it at all.
reviews.title: Great all rounder

reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location, plenty of resturants nearby , not too far to the train station. I think this is probably the best hotel we have stayed in when doing a city break. Would definately recommend it.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel experience

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, sharing with work collegues. We had a conference at the Metro convention centre which was a 5 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great facilities, lovely room, location is great for being in the centre of toronto, parking is very expensive but there is parking round the corner on a side street off windsor st,(the one down the side st, not the one on windsor) who negotiated for the 3 days with in and out access.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: I have visited this hotel twice in the past 6 months (once on New Years Eve and once June 7th) and can safely say it will continue to be my first choice when staying downtown! This hotel is an excellent value for bigger groups but also very reasonable for singles and couples as well ($200 a night taxes in). Rooms are spotless and each has a great kitchen/sitting area/washroom….much larger than the average hotel room! Check in/out was easy and friendly each visit. The beds are very comfortable, there is a great flat screen tv, and the modern styling of the rooms are very attractive! This hotel has a great location only a couple blocks from the subway and right around the corner from the CN Tower and Rogers Centre. One extra benefit….buffet breakfast is provided complimentary each morning of your stay (something for everyone!). I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anybody! Enjoy Toronto!
reviews.title: Residence Inn continues to be my hotel of choice downtown!

likes.liked: — comfy beds, great pillows and linens!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The MRI is in the perfect location. We parked our rental at the hotel and didn't use it once. Everything is within walking distance. Less than 2 blocks to Rogers Centre and CN Tower, Tons of restaurants, bars and clubs in the streets that follow, although the MRI is on a quiet street (which is good).
reviews.title: Residence Inn is THEEE place to stay, loved it!!!

likes.liked: — Felt like a 4 star luxury hotel.

reviews.text: The hotel itself is in excellent condition. Very modern and clean. The rooms also very modern. Bathroom is one of the nicest I've used at a hotel. The bed was comfy with nice, quality, clean pillows and sheets. Not much use for the kitchenette with a short stay but defiitely nice also. Granite countertops, icemaker in freezer, everything you need to cook or eat a meal. LCD tv was nice to have if even for only a few minutes of watching.
reviews.title: Kudos to the Staff
Excellent value, this hotel ticks all the boxes
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful to tourists such as myself. They provided suggestions, directions and maps. The hotel also provides a complimentary buffet breakfast which was not only good quality but good to the checkbook.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn for a week while we did the tourist thing around Toronto. The room was very nice, though the carpet was a bit dingy. We loved that it had a kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator and ice-maker, coffee maker, microwave and two-burner stove, as well as plates, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. We didn't cook for ourselves, but it was nice to know that we could if we wanted! Bathroom was nice; everything seemed new. We had a great view of the CN Tower. Bed was nice and firm; we slept very well. TV was one of those widescreen TVs that automatically switches back to widescreen format every time you turn it on, which was annoying. Our room had a door to the adjacent room, and there were kids staying in there and we could hear them shrieking while they played, but otherwise it was very quiet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Elevators got a little too busy in the early evenings, and breakfast was a bit of a zoo, but the food was pretty good. No room service, but the phones had local takeaway places on speed-dial, and they provided a magazine listing nearby restaurants and their menus, so we didn't go hungry. The location was perfect, centrally located to everything we wanted to do, and just a block away from Second City. They had fruit-infused ice water in the lobby every day, which was very refreshing after a hot day walking around the city.
reviews.title: very pleasant stay

likes.disliked: — dingy carpet, busy elevators, crowded breakfast

reviews.text: pro's Big rooms, clean, friendly staff.
reviews.title: Needs restaurant

likes.disliked: — Total lack of restaurant or room service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: con's 30CA$ for parking, no room service, no restaurant.
reviews.title: A wonderful break

reviews.text: Just back from an great seven night stay in the Residence Inn. We picked this hotel for it's location to the CN Tower and other attractions and also because of it's excellent previous reviews and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.text: We were greeted after a very long day of travel by Bryan, a very friendly staff member on the front desk, who gave us lots of tips on where to eat out visit etc and a room with an excellent view.
reviews.title: Excellent for families

likes.disliked: — Breakfast became boring by end of week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in a 1 BR suite. The room was great. The entire staff at the hotel was the nicest we've ever encountered. Our only complaint was that the breakfast area is fairly small and it was very crowded. Next time we go to Toronto this will be our 1st choice.
reviews.title: Loved the Residence Inn

likes.liked: — Quality and size of the suite.
likes.disliked: — Small breakfast area relative to number of guests.

reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in August. It was a great location. We had a room on the 21st floor with a view of the lake/city. It was quiet. The service was excellent and attentive. The room was large with the amenities as described on other reviews. We didn't use the pool or the fitness center but it seemed about what I expected.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Husband and kids had breakfast every morning and really liked the selection. They had a wait about 10 minutes as they went at the height of breakfast. You gotta expect that sort of thing with 22 floors of room and a free breakfast, I think.
reviews.title: Can't imagine a better pick for a small family on vacation!

likes.disliked: — Small bathroom (but sink and vanity are separate)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The Valet was fine although I wasn't thrilled my car was not in a covered lot but eh, no big deal. (It was parked in the lot just around the corner)
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: This hotel deserves its TA rating. The location affords a short walk to varied food choices (King Street), CN Tower and Rogers Centre (baseball), and the Lake (Harbourfront, urban beach, and ferries to the Islands).
reviews.title: Amazing for the price
Great Location & Awesome Room
reviews.text: We stayed in the Residence Inn Toronto for 3 nights. Upon checking in, they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite which was huge. It has a full kitchen, dining table and living room with flat screen TV and windows with a view of the harbor and city. The separate bedroom had a super comfy bed and its own window with city views and the bathroom had a large vanity with a separate shower/toilet area. The room was fabulous and clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in the entertainment district which means there are tons of restaurants, shops and shows/comedy clubs within walking distance. In addition, the CN Tower and baseball stadium are within a few blocks and the entire harbor is about a 10 or 15 minute walk. We took the double decker hop on-off bus tour of the city which had stops within a block of the hotel so we saw the entire city as well as Casa Loma (which is definitely worth a visit) on a 2 day pass. We used the Grayline bus company, but I would never use them again. The buses were always 20 to 30 minutes late and they even went right by us even though we were standing at the stop waving when he flew by. Everyone that was on the Yellow Double Decker bus tour seemed to be much happier and the buses looked newer than the old run-down red gray line buses.
reviews.title: Definitely a New Favourite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several nights during the week that had free late afternoon drinks and appetizers in the lobby with food like fajitas, pizzas, pastas etc. The breakfast buffet was out of this world with make your own Belgian waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, muffins, bagels, breakfast potatoes, juices, coffee and more. We would definitely stay at this little gem in Toronto again!
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Great Hotel
Great find!
reviews.text: We were travelling with our 2 young boys and thought the accomodations were perfect for us. We had a one bedroom suite and requested a cot so that our boys had their own beds in the living area (there is a sofa bed as well). We were also surprised that there were no sheets on the sofa bed when it was time for the kids to go to bed, but there were sheets and blankets in the closet for the bed. We didn't ask for the staff to make it for us.

reviews.title: Excellent Rooms!
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location. Our young boys loved being able to walk to the CN Tower and to a Blue Jays game.

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.text: The staff was great - they were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was great too - something for everyone and certainly made the price of the room a bargain.

reviews.title: Unfortunate but I had problems...
reviews.text: The valet parking was great. We were in and out of the hotel many times over the weekend and they were very professional and had our car waiting for us quickly each time it was requested.

reviews.title: GORGEOUS HOTEL!! Beautiful room.
reviews.text: Overall, a great hotel in Toronto and a real bargain!
Clean. Great location. Good bed and pillows. Breakfast buffet sometimes has a line.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Stay

reviews.text: Just returned from a conference in Toronto and stayed at this environmentally friendly hotel for a week (yes they recycle etc). We picked this hotel after reading all the +ve reviews on TA and boy did we pick well! Throw in free internet access and a free breakfast buffet and you just can't beat this superb deal.
reviews.title: Best place to live in Toronto!
Very Nice Stay
reviews.text: Here's the skinny on our stay:

Rooms/Suites: We stayed in a King suite and it was outstanding! They have it stocked with everything from utensils, mugs for coffee and even a dishwasher. Tastefully appointed with contemporary decor (LCD tv etc.) and the housekeeping staff are just excellent.
reviews.title: Great Stay

aka: Residence Inn By Marriott Toronto Downtown / Entertainment District Hotel
description: Conveniently located in the heart of the downtown entertainment district, near major businesses, restaurants and attractions. Steps to CN Tower, Ripleys Aquarium, Metro Convention Centre, Rogers Centre and the Bell Light Box. Residence Inn has perfected the extended stay experience offering 256 stylish, oversized studio, one or two bedroom suites with full kitchens and living areas. Enjoy a complimentary, full, hot buffet breakfast and a light supper social 2-3 nights a week, from 6-7.30pm. Relax in the hot tub or pool area adjacent to the state-of-the art fitness centre.
